title: Quiz 10: Gynaecological Malignancies
description: Test your knowledge on the diagnosis, risk factors, and management of gynaecological cancers.

questions.question: What is the leading cause of mortality among women worldwide related to gynaecological cancer?
questions.explanation: Cancer of the cervix is highlighted as one of the leading causes of mortality.
questions.hint: It is screened for using a Pap smear.

questions.question: Which of the following are risk factors for Cancer of the Cervix? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Sexual activity risks (HPV) and high parity are risk factors. Nulliparity is a risk for *breast* cancer, not cervical.
questions.hint: Think about sexual exposure and childbirth trauma.

questions.question: Match the breast cancer surgery with its description:

richContent.content: Understanding surgical options is key to management.

pairs.right: Removal of breast, pectorals, and axillary nodes
Removal of breast and nodes, Pectoralis Major preserved

questions.explanation: Radical takes muscle; Modified saves muscle; Simple takes breast; Lumpectomy takes lump.
questions.hint: Focus on what is removed vs preserved.

questions.question: A ___BLANK___ is an abnormal pregnancy resulting in a mass of cysts resembling a bunch of grapes, often with high HCG levels.
questions.explanation: Hydatidiform mole (Molar pregnancy) presents with grape-like cysts and high HCG.

questions.question: Pain in the breast is the most common early symptom of breast cancer.
questions.explanation: 80% of cases present with a PAINLESS lump. Pain is usually associated with benign conditions like dysplasia.
questions.hint: Is cancer usually painful at the start?

questions.question: Which drug is primarily used in the chemotherapy of Choriocarcinoma?
questions.explanation: Methotrexate is the cytotoxic drug of choice for choriocarcinoma.

questions.question: Order the steps in the diagnosis of breast cancer:
questions.explanation: Clinical exam -> Imaging -> Tissue diagnosis -> Staging for treatment.

questions.question: Which sign is strongly suggestive of a Hydatidiform Mole?

options.text: Uterus smaller than expected for dates
Uterus larger than expected for dates with 'doughy' feel

questions.explanation: The uterus grows rapidly (larger than dates), feels doughy, and HCG is very high.

questions.question: What postoperative complication involves swelling of the arm following a radical mastectomy?
questions.explanation: Oedema (Lymphoedema) occurs due to lymphatic obstruction/removal of axillary nodes.

questions.question: Which of the following are signs of Cancer of the Cervix? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Bleeding (contact or post-menopausal) and offensive discharge from necrosis are classic signs.
questions.hint: Think about trauma to the cervix and necrotic tissue.
